SyllableStructureNotes: vowels are not allowed word-initially; it is unclear if they are allowed syllable-initially, it might be that there is always a glide or glottal stop in front of them

Region: Elam (ancient lands in the west and southwest of todays Iran)

PhonologyNotes: The phonemic inventory is not clear at all. This list follows P. O. SKJÆRVØ.
TimeDepth: uncertain, written from the 3rd century, but the language was extinct by then. Maybe with the start of the Zoroastrism around 600bc or same time as early Vedic around 1500 BCE

PhonologyNotes: same problems as in Hittite with the ponetic realisations
Region: zentral Anatolia northwards to the black sea

SyllableStructure: V; CV; VC; CVC; VCC; CVCC; CVCCC
SyllableStructureNotes: complex onset is unclear; CVCCC only in the ending -nts
PhonologyNotes: There is variation in the spelling of gemminates, which may or may not indicate phonemically distinct consonants.

SyllableStructure: V; VC; CV; CVC; CCV; CCVC; CCCVC
Region: Inscriptions found in modern Iran, Armenia, Bahrain, Romania (Gherla), Egypt, Turky, Iraq.

TimeDepth: 800 BC-300 AD; texts found from 800-500 (Paleo-Phrygian) BC and 100 AD - 300 (Neo-Phrygian)

PhonologyNotes: Consonantal length is not expressed in the script.
Melchert suggest, that all dialects share the same phonemic inventory
